articles.title: New band in town
articles.text:
Bastille drummer Woody has reassured fans that he and the band are OK after authorities shut down a music festival in Germany amid fears of a terror threat. 
The dpa news agency reported Friday that the Rock am Ring festival was cleared out on its opening night after Koblenz police said they had received information of a "concrete threat". 
Organisers posted on the festival website that "due to a terrorist threat the police have advised us to interrupt the festival".
Bastille were due to perform, and drummer Chris 'Woody' Wood, who grew up in Plymouth and went to Devonport High School for Boys, had a reassuring message for fans.
Read more at http://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/bastille-drummer-woody-says-band-is-ok-after-terror-threat-at-german-festival/story-30368837-detail/story.html#ct2xOHMqtUzrbxrQ.99
